p: where, S(t), E(t), I(t), and R(t) represent the number of susceptible, exposed, infected, and removed hosts at any given instant of time t. The temporal progress of an epidemic is modeled by transitioning a fraction of the population from one compartment to another (Anderson and May 1992; Daley and Gani 2001). The transition functions are typically modeled as ODEs with time as the independent variable.
